page.title: 19Domesday Survey Day _ Mulben
page.content: To_day is a Domesday Survey Day. I got up at eight o'clock, my usual time for a school day. For my breakfast I had tea and toast. After breakfast, I set off for school, remembering to bring my wellingtons. I would need them for the visits to two farms where we were going to interview the farmers as part of our Class Domesday Project Survey. The mini_bus arrived at 09.30, and we set off. We drove along the A95 and soon got our first view of the Hill of Mulderie. At Mr. Addison's farm, he told us about his prize _ winning beasts. We walked to the Level Crossing and saw the Watershed of two burns. On our way to the second farm we passed Glentauchers Distillery. Before returning to school, we visited the bonded warehouses.
